content: <ce:section-title>{[Cd(4,4′-bipy)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>](CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>}<ce:inf loc="post">∞</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">To a 20 ml ethanol solution containing Cd(CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.518 g, 1.0 mmol) and 4,4′-bipyridine (0.312 g, 2.0 mmol), H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O was added dropwise under stirring until the solution became clear or transparent (ca. 2 ml H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O). After refluxing for 3 h and cooling to room temperature, the solution was filtered by suction. The filtrate was allowed to evaporate at ambient temperature for a few weeks, after which time colorless needle crystals formed in 75% yield based on Cd(CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O. <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for CdC<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>F<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>S<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>: Cd, 17.60; S, 10.04; F, 17.84. Found: Cd, 17.47; S, 9.85; F, 18.08%. IR spectrum (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3398(b, s), 1598(m), 1408(m), 1266(s), 1153(m), 1041(m), 805(m), 647.5(m).</ce:para><ce:section-title>{[Cd(4,4′-bipy)(CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>](4,4′-bipy)}<ce:inf loc="post">∞</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">Samples of 0.259 g (0.5 mmol) Cd(CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O, 0.156 g (1.0 mmol) 4,4′-bipy and 0.168 g (1 mmol) 4-methoxy-2-nitroaniline (MNA) were ground, mixed thoroughly in a mortar with pestle, and placed in a thick-walled Pyrex tube (ca. 25 cm long). After addition of 1 ml 95% EtOH, the tube was frozen with liquid N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>, evacuated under vacuum and sealed with a torch. The tube was heated at 90°C for 12 h to give colorless single crystals of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> in 65% yield based on Cd(CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O. <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for CdC<ce:inf loc="post">22</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">20</ce:inf>F<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>S<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>: Cd, 14.81; S, 8.45; F, 15.02. Found: Cd, 14.61; S, 8.21; F, 15.24%. IR spectrum (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3418(b, s), 1662(w), 1596(m), 1536(w), 1493(w), 1415(m), 1264(s), 1149(s), 1046(s), 805(s), 648(s).</ce:para><ce:section-title>{[Cd(4,4′-bipy)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>](CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(4,4′-bipy)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(C<ce:inf loc="post">7</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>}<ce:inf loc="post">∞</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">In a typical experiment, H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O was added dropwise to a 20 ml EtOH solution containing Cd(CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.518 g, 1 mmol), 4,4′-bipy (0.468 g, 3 mmol) and MNA (0.336 g, 2 mmol) under stirring to clear the solution. After refluxing for 3 h and cooling to room temperature, the solution was filtered. The filtrate was allowed to evaporate at ambient temperature for a few weeks, after which time pale yellow block crystals formed in 65% yield based on Cd(CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O. <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for CdC<ce:inf loc="post">46</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">48</ce:inf>F<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>S<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>: Cd, 8.73; S, 4.98; F, 8.85. Found: Cd, 8.34; S, 4.71; F, 8.25%. IR spectrum (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3498(m), 3361(s), 1600(m), 1515(m), 1423(m), 1274(s), 1222(sh.m), 1150(m), 1046(m), 804(m), 641(m).</ce:para>
clean_text:
{[Cd(4,4'-bipy)(H2O)4](CF3SO3)2}∞ (1)

To a 20 ml ethanol solution containing Cd(CF3SO3)2⋅6H2O (0.518 g, 1.0 mmol) and 4,4'-bipyridine (0.312 g, 2.0 mmol), H2O was added dropwise under stirring until the solution became clear or transparent (ca. 2 ml H2O). After refluxing for 3 h and cooling to room temperature, the solution was filtered by suction. The filtrate was allowed to evaporate at ambient temperature for a few weeks, after which time colorless needle crystals formed in 75% yield based on Cd(CF3SO3)2⋅6H2O. Anal. Calc. for CdC12H16F6N2O12S2: Cd, 17.60; S, 10.04; F, 17.84. Found: Cd, 17.47; S, 9.85; F, 18.08%. IR spectrum (KBr, cm-1): 3398(b, s), 1598(m), 1408(m), 1266(s), 1153(m), 1041(m), 805(m), 647.5(m).

{[Cd(4,4'-bipy)(CF3SO3)2(H2O)2](4,4'-bipy)}∞ (2)

Samples of 0.259 g (0.5 mmol) Cd(CF3SO3)2⋅6H2O, 0.156 g (1.0 mmol) 4,4'-bipy and 0.168 g (1 mmol) 4-methoxy-2-nitroaniline (MNA) were ground, mixed thoroughly in a mortar with pestle, and placed in a thick-walled Pyrex tube (ca. 25 cm long). After addition of 1 ml 95% EtOH, the tube was frozen with liquid N2, evacuated under vacuum and sealed with a torch. The tube was heated at 90°C for 12 h to give colorless single crystals of 2 in 65% yield based on Cd(CF3SO3)2⋅6H2O. Anal. Calc. for CdC22H20F6N4O8S2: Cd, 14.81; S, 8.45; F, 15.02. Found: Cd, 14.61; S, 8.21; F, 15.24%. IR spectrum (cm-1): 3418(b, s), 1662(w), 1596(m), 1536(w), 1493(w), 1415(m), 1264(s), 1149(s), 1046(s), 805(s), 648(s).

{[Cd(4,4'-bipy)2(H2O)2](CF3SO3)2(4,4'-bipy)(H2O)2(C7H8N2O3)2}∞ (3)

In a typical experiment, H2O was added dropwise to a 20 ml EtOH solution containing Cd(CF3SO3)2⋅6H2O (0.518 g, 1 mmol), 4,4'-bipy (0.468 g, 3 mmol) and MNA (0.336 g, 2 mmol) under stirring to clear the solution. After refluxing for 3 h and cooling to room temperature, the solution was filtered. The filtrate was allowed to evaporate at ambient temperature for a few weeks, after which time pale yellow block crystals formed in 65% yield based on Cd(CF3SO3)2⋅6H2O. Anal. Calc. for CdC46H48F6N10O16S2: Cd, 8.73; S, 4.98; F, 8.85. Found: Cd, 8.34; S, 4.71; F, 8.25%. IR spectrum (cm-1): 3498(m), 3361(s), 1600(m), 1515(m), 1423(m), 1274(s), 1222(sh.m), 1150(m), 1046(m), 804(m), 641(m).
